item.title: Gauss-Newton Method on Manifold
item.description: Source: Forster 2017 IMU Preintegration Standard approach for optimization on manifold define a retraction to reparametrise the problem (lifting) retraction bijective map map between an element of the tangent space at x and a neighbourhood of x on the manifold i.e. we work in the tangent space (locally like a Euclidian space) and apply standard optimisation techniques for Gauss-Newton specifically: [ts] squared cost around current estimate [ts] solve the quadratic approximation –> we get vector in tangent space [m] update the current guess on the manifold Consider: Reparametrised: Retraction for SE(3) The exponential map of SE(3) as a retraction is possible, but may not be convenient (computationally)

item.title: Forster 2017 IMU Preintegration
item.description: Authors: Forster et al Abstract: First contribution: preintegration theory (building up on Lupton’s work) what’s different from Lupton’s: addresses manifold structure of the rotation group, analytic derivation of all Jacobians Lupton’s work uses Euler angles Using Euler angles and techniques of Euclidian spaces for state propagation/covariance estimation is not properly invariant under rigid transformations uncertainty propagation, a-posteriori bias correction same as Lupton: integration performed in local frame, eliminating need for reintegrating when linearisation point changes Second contribution: integration of the preintegrated IMU model into a visual-inertial pipeline The system presented uses incremental smoothing for fast computation of the optimal MAP estimate Uses structureless model (3D landmarks are not part of the variables to be estimated) for visual measurements –> allows eliminating large numbers of variables Motivation:
